facts.text: Appeal arises out of S.L.P.(C) No. 3358 of 2007

facts.text: Judgment and order dated 17th February 2006 passed by Single Judge of High Court of Punjab and Haryana in R.S.A. No.666/2006

anchor.surface_text: judgment and order dated 17th February, 2006 passed by a learned Single Judge of the High Court of Punjab and Haryana in R.S.A. No.666/2006 whereby the learned Single Judge has affirmed the judgment and decree passed by the First Appellate Court.

facts.text: Single Judge affirmed judgment and decree of First Appellate Court

anchor.surface_text: whereby the learned Single Judge has affirmed the judgment and decree passed by the First Appellate Court. The brief facts which are necessary for the disposal of the present appeal are that the plaintiffs  respondents

facts.text: Plaintiffs-respondents appointed as Mali gardener in service of defendant-appellant golf club run by Haryana Tourism Corporation in 1989 and 1988 respectively on daily wages

anchor.surface_text: the plaintiffs  respondents in this appeal  were appointed as Mali  gardener  in the service of the defendant-appellant, which is a golf club run by the Haryana Tourism Corporation in the year 1989 and 1988 respectively on daily wages.

facts.text: In 1989 plaintiffs told to perform duties of Tractor Drivers though no post of tractor driver in establishment

anchor.surface_text: Subsequently in the year 1989 they were told to perform the duties of Tractor Drivers, though there was numberpost of tractor driver in the employers establishment.

facts.text: Plaintiffs continued to be paid wages for post of Mali for number of years

anchor.surface_text: However for a number of years they companytinued to be paid wages for the post of Mali. Thereafter on a recommendation made by the Head Office,

facts.text: Appellants started paying wages of tractor driver on daily wage basis per rates recommended by Deputy Commissioner

anchor.surface_text: the appellants started paying them wages of tractor driver on daily wage basis, as per rates recommended by the Deputy Commissioner. Though they companytinued to work for about a decade as tractor drivers,

facts.text: Services of plaintiffs regularized against post of Mali in 1999

anchor.surface_text: their services were regularized against the post of Mali in the year 1999 and number as tractor driver.

facts.text: Respondents filed civil suit in April 2001 claiming regularization against posts of tractor driver

anchor.surface_text: When despite representations their grievance was number redressed, the respondents herein filed civil suit in the month of April, 2001 claiming regularization against the posts of tractor driver.

facts.text: Trial Court rejected claim observing no post of tractor driver and dismissed suit

anchor.surface_text: Their claim was rejected by the Trial Court which observed that there was numberpost of tractor driver in the establishment, and the suit was dismissed.

facts.text: Trial Court held plying tractor is part and parcel of job of Mali in Golf Club

anchor.surface_text: The Trial Court held that plying a tractor is part and parcel of the job of Mali in a Golf Club, since the Golf Field of the Club is vast and needs to be maintained with mechanical gadgets.

facts.text: First Appellate Court Additional District Judge Faridabad accepted appeal set aside Trial Court judgment directed sanction post of tractor driver and regularize plaintiffs

anchor.surface_text: Aggrieved against the said order of dismissal of the suit, the respondents herein preferred an appeal before the Additional District Judge, Faridabad. Their appeal was accepted and the judgment and decree of the Trial Court was set aside. The First Appellate Court observed that the defendants were taking the work of tractor driver from the plaintiffs since 13.8.1999, and hence it directed the defendants to get the post of tractor driver sanctioned, and to regularize the plaintiffs on that post.

facts.text: High Court Single Judge affirmed First Appellate Court directed creation of post of tractor driver

anchor.surface_text: The learned Single Judge held that the post of tractor driver should be created as there is numberhitch in number creating the posts of drivers especially when tractors were available and there existed need to use those tractors.

facts.text: Plaintiff-respondents admitted in plaint appointed as Mali

anchor.surface_text: The plaintiff-respondents admitted in the plaint that they were appointed as Mali.

facts.text: Respondent No.1 appointed as Mali on daily wage basis on 9.10.1989

anchor.surface_text: The appellants in their written statement submitted that the plaintiffs were appointed as Mali on a daily wage basis on 9.10.1989.

facts.text: Respondent No.1 filed Writ Petition No.6216/1991 for regularizing services

anchor.surface_text: The respondent No.1 had earlier filed Writ Petition No.6216/1991 for regularizing his services.

facts.text: Respondent No.1 made representation for regularization on 2.5.1991

anchor.surface_text: In pursuance of the said order the respondent No.1 made representation for regularization of his service on 2.5.1991.

facts.text: Plaintiff-respondent informed vide order dated 14.5.1991 no post of tractor driver

anchor.surface_text: The plaintiff- respondent was informed vide order dated 14.5.1991 that there was numberpost of tractor driver and his case for regularization would be companysidered as and when sanctioned post of the tractor deriver will be available.

facts.text: Plaintiff No.1 paid wages of tractor driver from August 1990 to 11.5.1999 on daily wage DC rate

anchor.surface_text: The plaintiff-respondent was paid wages of tractor deriver from August 1990 to 11.5.1999 on daily wage basis on D.C. rate as he was asked to work as a tractor driver.

facts.text: Services of plaintiff No.1 regularized as Mali vide order dated 11.5.1999 accepted without protest

anchor.surface_text: In the meanwhile services of plaintiff No.1 was regularized as Mali vide order dated 11.5.1999 which was duly accepted by him without any protest.

facts.text: Respondent No.2 engaged as Mali on daily wage basis w.e.f. 1.9.1988 regularized as Mali 11.5.1999

anchor.surface_text: Similar is the case of respondent No.2 herein. He was engaged as Mali on daily wage basis w.e.f. 1.9.1988 and his services were also regularized as Mali vide order dated 11.5.1999.

facts.text: No sanctioned post of tractor driver in appellants establishment

anchor.surface_text: It is number disputed that there is numbersanctioned post of tractor driver in the appellants establishment.

facts.text: Supreme Court sets aside judgments of High Court and First Appellate Court upholds Trial Court dismisses suit

anchor.surface_text: Since there is numbersanctioned post of tractor driver against which the respondents companyld be regularized as tractor driver, the direction of the First Appellate Court and the learned Single Judge to create the post of tractor driver and regularizing the services of the respondents against the said newly created posts was in our opinion companypletely beyond their jurisdiction. ... Therefore, the directions given by the High Court and First Appellate Court to create the posts of tractor driver and regularize the services of the respondents against the said posts cannot be sustained and are hereby set aside. Consequently, this appeal is allowed and the judgment and order of the High Court as well as that of the First Appellate Court are set aside and the judgment of the Trial Court is upheld. The suit is dismissed.

anchor.surface_text: It is not disputed that there is nosanctioned post of tractor driver in the appellants establishment.

Therefore, the directions given by the High Court and First Appellate Court to create the posts of tractor driver and regularize the services of the respondents against the said posts cannot be sustained and are hereby set aside. Consequently, this appeal is allowed and the judgment and order of the High Court as well as that of the First Appellate Court are set aside and the judgment of the Trial Court is upheld. The suit is dismissed. No costs.

anchor.surface_text: This is a finding of fact recorded by the Trial Court and it was never disputed at any stage. Aggrieved against the said judgment the respondents herein filed an appeal and the learned First Appellate Court without going into the merit of the matter set aside the judgment

Therefore, the directions given by the High Court and First Appellate Court to create the posts of tractor driver and regularize the services of the respondents against the said posts cannot be sustained and are hereby set aside. Consequently, this appeal is allowed and the judgment and order of the High Court as well as that of the First Appellate Court are set aside and the judgment of the Trial Court is upheld. The suit is dismissed. No costs.

Since there is nosanctioned post of tractor driver against which the respondents could be regularized as tractor driver, the direction of the First Appellate Court and the learned Single Judge to create the post of tractor driver and regularizing the services of the respondents against the said newly created posts was in our opinion completely beyond their jurisdiction. The Court cannot direct the creation of posts.

Therefore, the directions given by the High Court and First Appellate Court to create the posts of tractor driver and regularize the services of the respondents against the said posts cannot be sustained and are hereby set aside. Consequently, this appeal is allowed and the judgment and order of the High Court as well as that of the First Appellate Court are set aside and the judgment of the Trial Court is upheld. The suit is dismissed. No costs.

The Court cannot direct the creation of posts. Creation and sanction of posts is a prerogative of the executive or legislative authorities and the Court cannot arrogate to itself this purely executive or legislative function, and direct creation of posts in any organization. This Court has time and again pointed out that the creation of a post is an executive or legislative function

Therefore, the directions given by the High Court and First Appellate Court to create the posts of tractor driver and regularize the services of the respondents against the said posts cannot be sustained and are hereby set aside. Consequently, this appeal is allowed and the judgment and order of the High Court as well as that of the First Appellate Court are set aside and the judgment of the Trial Court is upheld. The suit is dismissed. No costs.

Therefore, the directions given by the High Court and First Appellate Court to create the posts of tractor driver and regularize the services of the respondents against the said posts cannot be sustained and are hereby set aside. Consequently, this appeal is allowed and the judgment and order of the High Court as well as that of the First Appellate Court are set aside and the judgment of the Trial Court is upheld. The suit is dismissed. No costs.
